content:
I am a PhD student at Boston University’s Department of Computer Science. I am interested in cryptography and intersecting topics from quantum computing, complexity theory, and number theory.
In June 2019, I graduated with a BSc summa cum laude from the American University in Cairo (AUC), Egypt where I studied mathematics and computer engineering. Previously, I interned with Microsoft Research, Affectiva, Twitter, EPFL, and IPAM at UCLA.
  Download my CV.
 I organize a mailing list and reading group on post-quantum and quantum cryptography (pq2c) at BU (well, virtually!).
 Learn more and subscribe!
 Get in touch to give a talk!
summary:

title: Islam Faisal

summary: We introduce a fully decentralized auditable framework for privacy-preserving aggregation.
title: USENIX Lightning Talk: Fully decentralized auditable framework for privacy-preserving aggregation

summary: In this paper, we introduce an access-controlled limited proxying framework to allow HTTPS content filtering based on the Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) Proxy Certificate Profile.
title: Limited Proxying for Content Filtering Based on X.509 Proxy Certificate Profile
Convolutional Neural Networks and Metric Learning for Facial Verification

content:
Mailing List We use the mailing list pq2c-rg at cs dot bu dot edu for announcements of talks and any related opportunities. Please sign-up here. You can also add the calendar below to your calendar for schedule of talks.
  If you would like to present, please send an email to islam at bu dot edu.
Spring 2021 Schedule will be upcoming soon.
Summer 2020 In summer 2020, we started a series of themed virtual talks around the quantum PCP conjecture. Visit this link for the talks and and resources.
Fall 2019 Timing and Venue: Wednesday 2:30 - 3:30 PM at MCS B39 (111 Cummington Mall, Boston, MA). Due to constructions, please look for the stairs with the sign “access to classroom B39”.
 Nov. 6th: Quantum Collision Finding (Speaker: Mark Bun) Nov. 13th: Quantum And Relativistic Protocols For Secure Multi-Party Computation (Roger Colbeck) (Speaker: Ari Karchmer) Dec. 11th: Classical Homomorphic Encryption for Quantum Circuits (Urmila Mahadev) (Speaker: Islam Faisal)  Calendar  Related Seminars Around (in Crypto and TCS)  BUSec calendar for BUSec seminar and MPC reading group BU Theory Seminar Charles River Crypto Day MIT CIS Seminar MIT TOC Colloquium Series
summary: This is a mailing list and reading group about post-quantum and quantum cryptography (pq2c).
title: Quantum Cryptography Reading Group
